about.body_html:
Customs and foreign trade involve constantly updated regulations, document flows, and time pressure. Traditional methods can be slow, hard to track, and costly. Easycustoms360 is a Customs Consultancy Service Platform built on the infrastructure of Consphera Technology & Consultancy, which unites engineering, consulting, and artificial intelligence.

Our aim is to combine technology with customs expertise to make access to the expertise required for foreign trade and customs processes fast, expert-driven, transparent, and traceable.

Accordingly, our in-house Consphera PSA (Professional Services Automation) backbone automates—end to end—intake, pre-assessment, risk scoring, AI-assisted instant pricing, SLA management, expert selection, quality control, invoicing, and reporting, making the consultancy flow traceable from first contact to delivery.

What We Do with Easycustoms360

  • Simplifying complex regulation with expertise: making problem areas understandable through expert analysis and offering applicable solutions.
  • Standardizing speed: instant offers, response times, real-time notifications, and tracking screens for predictable service.
  • Trust through expertise: the ability to choose a topic-specific expert and two-stage quality control.
  • Cost and flexibility: per-question or credit-based model; one-off payments and subscription scenarios.
  • Traceability and compliance: all processes are recorded and comply with GDPR principles; data security strengthened with role-based access and encryption.

Vision

To digitize foreign trade and customs consultancy; to standardize speed, accuracy, and trust in one package; to become a globally referenced “new norm” for regulation-based consultancy—supported by a scalable architecture, measurable SLAs, and continuous improvement.

Our Values

  • Trust: Accurate information, clear contracts, traceable process.
  • Competence: Expert team, continuous training, and up-to-date legislation tracking.
  • Speed: Short response times, effective automation, smart prioritization.
  • Privacy & Compliance: Data processing aligned with GDPR principles and standards.
  • Continuous Improvement: A product that evolves with user feedback; we track performance/experience metrics every release and deliver visible improvements.

Our Founder

Our founder, Gökhan Yurdakul, spent the first ten years of his career at the Republic of Türkiye Ministry of Trade, playing an active role in drafting both legislation and the regulations that guide implementation. He then joined PwC Türkiye, and over the next ten years he blended his public-sector experience with the private sector’s needs—identifying requirements and delivering practical, applicable solutions.

Recognizing that customs and foreign trade processes require continuous improvement, and that rapid access to information on current or planned matters can significantly increase the value created—while traditional methods fall short in this respect—he founded EasyCustoms360.com.

howItWorksIndividual.intro_html:
Easycustoms360 is an online platform that makes customs consulting fast, traceable, and transparent. You upload your question and related documents; based on the information and files you provide, the system performs a pre-check and generates a clear offer with a target delivery time (SLA). You make the payment and securely receive your answer via the portal. You manage every step of the consulting process from a single platform.

If you have any questions, please reach us via the Contact page.
howItWorksIndividual.tab1_html:
A) Membership and Profile

• You must be a member to use the service.

• Keep your profile and invoicing details up to date for accurate notifications and billing.

B) Creating a Question

1. Open the /ask page and start the “Ask a Question” step. Carefully read and accept the disclosure shown.

2. Write your question clearly and concretely; attach your documents if any (PDF/DOCX/XLSX/JPG/PNG). For accurate pricing, check the “Ask Question tips” section at the top-right of the description field.

3. You may mark the request as Urgent. Urgent work is delivered faster and an urgency multiplier is applied to the fee.

4. When you click “Calculate Offer”, the system runs pre-checks, calculates final price depending on various criterias to determine the required hours to answer your question. If the topic cannot be reasonably linked to customs legislation or information is missing, you will be warned and guided. Missing details affect both pricing and the quality of the answer; adjust per the warnings and calculate again.

Note: You can complete missing details or proceed with them missing and still view the offer.

C) Offer and Target Delivery

You will see the following in the offer box:

• Estimated duration and target delivery time (SLA)

• Normal and Urgent delivery options

• Price summary (dynamically calculated based on scope)

• Credit requirement (if you will pay with credits)

You can also download the offer as a PDF by clicking Download PDF button.

You can Approve or Reject the offer. If you reject it, you can access it again later from the My Questions - Deatil screen via “Go to Offer”.

D) Payment Options

1. Card payment (Paddle – USD): Secure Paddle Billing is used; your card details are not processed/stored by Easycustoms360. After a successful transaction your order is matched automatically; the status becomes “Approved” on the My Questions - Detail screen. You can access your payment details under My Payments.

2. Pay with credits: If you have credits, use the “Pay with Credits” button. After approval, your credit balance is updated instantly. If you do not have credits, you can quickly top up by using Buy Credits (see the “Credits Management” tab).

E) Question Panel and Communication

After payment, open My Questions → click “Details” on the relevant question to open the panel; you manage everything from here. The answer status shows whether the work is ongoing or completed. If needed, the consultant may request additional information/documents. All question related querries can be managed in this panel. All correspondence remains recorded inside the portal and is also notified via email.

F) Work and Delivery

When the work is completed, the answer is uploaded to the panel, the status becomes “Delivered”, and you are notified by email. You can view the answer on the portal and download it as a PDF.
howItWorksIndividual.tab2_html:
A) Buying Credits

1. Open the Credits Management panel.

2. Check your current Credit balance.

3. View credit pricing; the unit price may change periodically and may be more advantageous for higher amounts.

4. Enter the amount of credit you want to load and click the “Load Credits” button.

5. Review and approve the information on the confirmation screen, then complete the transaction via the payment provider.

6. The credits you purchase are reflected to your balance instantly and ready for use.

7. You can view purchase and usage activity in their respective tabs.

Note: Paying with credits lets you complete the flow quickly right after approving the offer by clicking “Pay with Credits”.

B) Invoicing

Your invoice will be sent to your registered email address. We recommend keeping Profile → Billing Information accurate and up to date.

howItWorksCorporate.intro_html:
Easycustoms360 is an online platform that makes customs consulting fast, traceable, and transparent. You upload your question and related documents; based on the information and files you provide, the system performs a pre-check and generates a clear offer with a target delivery time (SLA). You make the payment and securely receive your answer via the portal. You manage every step of the consulting process from a single platform.

If you have any questions, please reach us via the Contact page.
howItWorksCorporate.tab1_html:
A) Subcription concept

For corporate users, the recommended payment method is organization credits. You load the credit balance on behalf of the company; authorized team members can use this balance for questions. This provides a fast and controllable payment flow without dealing with individual card transactions.

B) Buying credits

1. Open the Subscription menu.

2. Check your current credit balance.

3. View credit pricing. (The unit price may change periodically and may be more advantageous for higher amounts.)

4. Enter the amount of credit you want to load and click the “Load Credits” button.

5. Review and approve the information on the confirmation screen; complete the transaction via the payment provider.

6. The credits you purchase are reflected to your balance instantly and ready for use

7. You can view purchase and usage activity in their respective tabs.

Note: Only the Subscription Administrator (the user who loads credits on behalf of the company) has the authority to load organization credits and manage plans/subscriptions.

C) User authorization

• Go to Subscription → click the “Authorize” button.

• Enter the email address of the user who will be allowed to transact with organization credits and click “Authorize”.

• The user appears in the list; you can revoke authorization with Remove.

• Authorized users cannot see credit loading/plan information; they can only pay for questions using credits.

Team usage statistics can be viewed from the “Usage” button and exported to Excel.

D) Invoicing

• Your invoice will be sent to your registered email address.

• Keep Profile → Billing Information accurate and up to date.
howItWorksCorporate.tab2_html:
A) Creating a question

1. Start the “Ask a Question” flow (read and accept the disclosure).

2. Describe your question clearly and concretely; attach relevant documents if any (PDF/DOCX/XLSX/JPG/PNG).

For accurate pricing, check the “As Question tips” section at the top-right of the description field.

3. Consultant selection: You can optionally select a consultant from the list if available; if no selection is made, the system assigns a suitable expert from Easycustoms360 team.

4. You may mark the request as Urgent. Urgent work is delivered in a shorter time; an urgency multiplier is applied to the fee.

B) Pre-check, offer, and SLA

• When you click Calculate Offer, the system runs pre-checks, calculates final price depending on various criterias to determine the required hours to answer your question. If the topic is not aligned with customs legislation or information is missing, warnings and guidance are provided.

• Missing details may affect both the price and the quality of the answer; adjust per the warnings and calculate again.

• Offer box: Estimated duration and target delivery (SLA); Normal/Urgent delivery options; dynamic price summary based on scope; credit requirement.

You can download the offer as a PDF by clicking Download PDF button.

You can Approve or Reject the offer. If you reject it, you can access it again from My Questions → Details on the relevant question via “Go to Offer”.

C) Payment options

Primary flow: pay with organization credits

•If credit is sufficient: click “Use Organization Credits”, review the confirmation screen and approve. The balance is updated instantly.

• If credit is insufficient: add new credit via “Top-up Organization Credits” (Subscription Administrator only). In addition, if the credit amount is insufficient, when authorized team members click the relevant notice shown to them, the system notifies the Subscription Administrator about this.

Alternative flow:pay by card

• In exceptional cases, the question can also be paid by card.

• Paddle Billing is used; your card details are not processed/stored by Easycustoms360.

• After a successful transaction, the order is matched automatically; the question status becomes “Approved” on the My Questions -Details screen.

• You can access the payment summary under My Payments.

D) Question panel and communication

• After payment, open My Questions → click “Details” on the relevant question; manage the entire process from here.

• The answer status shows whether the work is ongoing or completed.

• If needed, the consultant may request additional information. All question related querries can be managed in this panel. All correspondence is recorded inside the portal and notified via email.

E) Work and delivery

• When the work is completed, the answer is uploaded to the panel, the status becomes “Delivered”, and you are notified by email.

• You can view the answer on the portal and download it as a PDF.

meta.title: Privacy Notice (GDPR / UK GDPR)
meta.description: Privacy information for personal data processed by Consphera Teknoloji ve Danışmanlık Ltd. Şti. under the EasyCustoms360 services, prepared in line with GDPR.

privacy.title: Privacy Notice (GDPR / UK GDPR)
privacy.content_html:
Controller: Consphera Teknoloji ve Danışmanlık Ltd. Şti. ("Consphera", "we", "us")
Registered address: Nisbetiye Mahallesi, Nisbetiye Caddesi No:24 Da:17 Beşiktaş /İSTANBUL
Contact: support@easycustoms360.com

This Notice explains how we process personal data when you use easycustoms360.com and their subdomains (e.g., tr.easycustoms360.com) and the related services branded EasyCustoms360.

1) Scope & Who this applies to

  • Site visitors, account holders, and representatives of customers/prospects
  • Representatives of suppliers and business partners
  • Job applicants

2) Categories of personal data we process

  • Identity & contact: name, title, company, email, phone.
  • Account & usage: username, hashed password, preferences, session/activity logs, support tickets.
  • Transaction & billing: order/contract records, invoicing/tax data.
  • Payment: we do not store full card details; payments are handled by our payment provider.
  • Content you submit: files/info shared for consultancy (attachments, messages).
  • Technical & security: IP address, device/browser info, timestamps, error logs.
  • Marketing preferences: newsletter opt-in/out, campaign interactions.
  • Cookies/Similar tech: essential, analytics, functional and (with consent) marketing cookies.

We do not intentionally collect special categories of data. If your documents contain such data, please redact/mask it before sharing.

3) Purposes & legal bases (Art. 6 GDPR)

PurposeLegal basis
Account registration, providing the Services, support, contract managementContract necessity (Art. 6(1)(b))
Billing, invoicing, tax & complianceLegal obligation (Art. 6(1)(c))
Security, fraud prevention, monitoring, improvement, internal reportingLegitimate interests (Art. 6(1)(f))
Newsletters, product updates, analytics/marketing cookiesConsent (Art. 6(1)(a))
Handling queries, pre-contractual stepsContract necessity (Art. 6(1)(b)) / Legitimate interests (Art. 6(1)(f))
Recruitment & candidate evaluationLegitimate interests (Art. 6(1)(f)) / Consent where required

Legitimate interests include operating a safe, reliable platform; detecting misuse; improving features; and managing our B2B/B2C relationships.

4) Sources of data

  • Directly from you (forms, uploads, support, email/phone)
  • Automatically via our Services (logs, cookies)
  • Your organisation (if you are its representative)
  • Public or third-party sources where appropriate (e.g., sanctions/PEP screening if legally required)

5) International transfers (Arts. 44–49)

Where data is transferred outside the EEA/UK, we rely on adequacy decisions, the Standard Contractual Clauses (and the UK Addendum/IDTA as applicable) with appropriate technical/organizational measures, or your explicit consent (Art. 49(1)(a)) when required.

6) Retention

DataTypical retentionRationale
Account/contract & invoicing records10 yearscommercial & tax laws
Security & system logsup to 2 yearssecurity, fraud prevention, disputes
Marketing preferencesuntil withdrawnconsent management
Job applicationsprocess + 1 yearapplications & disputes
Cookies data6–24 monthsconsent/necessity

7) Automated decision-making / profiling (Art. 22)

We use automated processing (e.g., workload scoring, pre-pricing) to assist operations. These tools support decisions and do not by themselves produce legal or similarly significant effects.

8) Cookies

Essential cookies are always on (security/session). Analytics/marketing cookies operate only with your consent. See the Cookie Policy for details and to manage preferences.

9) Your rights (EEA & UK)

  • Access (Art. 15), Rectification (Art. 16), Erasure (Art. 17)
  • Restriction (Art. 18), Portability (Art. 20)
  • Object to processing based on legitimate interests and to profiling (Art. 21)
  • Withdraw consent at any time (without affecting past processing)
  • Not to be subject to decisions based solely on automated processing with legal/similar significant effects (Art. 22)

10) How to exercise your rights

Email: support@easycustoms360.com
We respond within one month (extendable where permitted). We may verify identity and, where requests are excessive, charge a reasonable fee.

11) Complaints

You may lodge a complaint with your local Supervisory Authority (EEA list via EDPB; UK: ICO). We would appreciate the chance to resolve your concerns first.

12) Security

We implement technical, organisational and contractual measures (encryption in transit, access controls, backups, logging/monitoring, vulnerability management and supplier due diligence). In case of a personal data breach, we assess and notify authorities and affected individuals when legally required.

13) Children

Our Services are intended for adults; we do not knowingly collect data from persons under 18. If you believe a minor has provided data, contact us to remove it.

14) Changes to this Notice

We may update this Notice. The updated version becomes effective when posted. For material changes, we will provide a prominent notice.

15) Contact

Consphera Teknoloji ve Danışmanlık Ltd. Şti.
Nisbetiye Mahallesi, Nisbetiye Caddesi No:24 Da:17 Beşiktaş /İSTANBUL
support@easycustoms360.com

meta.title: Terms of Service
meta.description: Terms governing the EasyCustoms360 platform and services provided by Consphera Teknoloji ve Danışmanlık Ltd. Şti.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.content_html:
These Terms of Service (“Terms”) govern access to and use of the EasyCustoms360 platforms and domains (together, the “Platform”) and all related products and services (consulting by competent/qualified experts, content, training, credit-based features, and other functionality, collectively the “Services”) provided by Consphera Teknoloji ve Danışmanlık Ltd. Şti. (“Consphera,” “we,” “our,” or “us”). By visiting or using the Platform/Services, you (“User,” “you,” or “customer”) agree to these Terms.

These Terms are intended for B2C and B2B use. Mandatory consumer protection rules in your country/region prevail over any conflicting provision herein.

1) Definitions

Tenant: A logical, segregated space set up for each customer/organization in our multi-tenant architecture.
Credits: Numeric usage units consumed by certain features or actions.
Expert Answer: The final response/report prepared and reviewed exclusively by competent/qualified human experts.
Pricing Engine: Automation and/or AI components used only for pricing/score estimation. It does not generate consulting answers or drafts.
Third Parties: Payment processors, infrastructure, identity, analytics, hosting, and similar providers.

2) Agreement & Scope

2.1. Creating an account, accessing the Platform, or using the Services constitutes acceptance of these Terms.
2.2. These Terms are concluded electronically; electronic notices are valid and enforceable.

3) Accounts, Tenants, and Access

3.1. Each customer may have a distinct tenant. Tenant admins manage invitations, roles, and permissions.
3.2. You are responsible for safeguarding your credentials and for activities under your account. Notify us promptly of any unauthorized use.

4) Nature of Services — Expert-Only Answers (No AI content generation)

4.1. All consulting answers are prepared and approved only by competent/qualified human experts.
4.2. The Pricing Engine is used solely for pricing/score estimation; it does not produce legal/technical content or drafts.
4.3. Customs, trade, and tax laws change frequently. All answers are for informational purposes only and are not definitive or binding opinions.
4.4. You must verify matters directly with the relevant public authorities before making decisions or filings.
4.5. You are solely responsible for the accuracy/completeness of information and documents you provide for any official process.

5) Acceptable Use

You may not use the Platform/Services to:
a) Violate laws, mislead, or infringe third-party rights;
b) Process or share personal data unlawfully;
c) Share accounts, impersonate, or manipulate access via multiple accounts;
d) Probe, scan, reverse engineer, or stress-test the Platform without authorization;
e) Promote illegal products/services;
f) Bypass or abuse the credit/pricing model.
We may suspend or terminate accounts for violations.

6) Pricing, Credits, and Payments

6.1. Credits. Certain features consume credits.
6.2. Pricing. Prices are determined by our internal policies and automations; specific criteria are not disclosed.
6.3. Taxes. Prices shown at checkout will include or add applicable taxes as required by law and by your billing location.
6.4. Instant Charge. Payments are processed immediately via authorized third-party providers.
6.5. Refunds. Due to the digital nature of the Services, used credits are non-refundable. In case of an erroneous charge, we may provide a pro-rata refund or credit.

7) Content Ecosystem (Blog, News, User Content)

7.1. Blog/News content is general information only; we do not guarantee accuracy, completeness, or timeliness.
7.2. You are solely responsible for the legality of any content you upload.
7.3. By uploading content, you grant us a worldwide, non-exclusive, royalty-free license to host, display, and use it within the Platform.

8) Intellectual Property

8.1. The Platform, software, designs, data models, training materials, and brands are owned by Consphera or its licensors.
8.2. Reverse engineering, reproduction, resale, or sublicensing is prohibited.
8.3. Feedback or suggestions are licensed to us on a free, transferable, non-exclusive basis.

9) Data Protection & Security

9.1. Our Privacy Notice and Cookie Policy form part of these Terms.
9.2. Depending on context, Consphera may act as a data controller and/or processor. Sub-processors (hosting, storage, analytics, payments) may be used.
9.3. We implement reasonable administrative and technical safeguards, but no system is perfectly secure.
9.4. You remain responsible for any highly sensitive, case-specific information you share or handle outside the Platform.

10) Third-Party Services

10.1. Payments, identity, storage, analytics, and certain features are provided by third parties under their own terms.
10.2. We accept no responsibility for any direct or indirect losses arising from third-party changes, outages, or actions.

11) Service Level, Maintenance, and Changes

11.1. The Platform is provided “as is” and “as available” with no guarantee of uninterrupted service.
11.2. We may maintain, upgrade, add, or remove features. Material changes will be reasonably notified.

12) Disclaimers & Comprehensive Limitation of Liability

12.1. All information and Expert Answers are informational only and not definitive/binding opinions.
12.2. You are solely responsible for any and all actions, filings, statements, calculations, or decisions made based on the Platform/Services. You will verify directly with public authorities as needed.
12.3. To the maximum extent permitted by law, we accept no liability of any kind—including direct, indirect, special, incidental, consequential, punitive, or loss of profit, reputation, or data—arising from or related to the Platform/Services, your reliance on any information, third-party services, network/communication issues, user error, or incomplete/inaccurate information/documents you provide.
12.4. No limitation, cap, carve-out, or exception shall be construed in your favor beyond what mandatory law imposes.
Consumer notice: Any non-waivable rights under mandatory consumer law remain unaffected.

13) Term, Suspension, and Termination

13.1. These Terms take effect upon acceptance.
13.2. We may suspend or terminate your account for AUP violations, legal non-compliance, or security risks.
13.3. Data may be retained for a reasonable period as required by law.

14) Changes to the Terms

14.1. We may update these Terms; the Effective Date will be revised and reasonable notice provided.
14.2. Continued use of the Platform after changes constitutes acceptance.

15) Governing Law & Jurisdiction

15.1. These Terms are governed by the laws of Türkiye (without regard to conflict-of-laws rules).
15.2. Courts of İstanbul (Central) shall have jurisdiction, unless mandatory consumer jurisdiction rules in your country/region require otherwise.

16) Notices & Contact

16.1. Contractual notices may be delivered via in-Platform notifications or to your registered email address.
16.2. Contact: Consphera Teknoloji ve Danışmanlık Ltd. Şti.
Address: Nisbetiye Mahallesi, Nisbetiye Caddesi No:24 Da:17 Beşiktaş /İSTANBUL
E-mail: support@easycustoms360.com

17) Severability & Assignment

17.1. If any provision is found invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions remain in force.
17.2. You may not assign these Terms without our consent. We may assign in connection with a business transfer or reorganization.

18) Order of Precedence & Policies

18.1. These Terms apply together with our Privacy Notice, Cookie Policy, and any applicable order/offer/plan.
18.2. In case of conflict: any specific written agreement (order/proposal) → these Terms → policies.

Acknowledgment

By using the Platform/Services, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agreed to these Terms.

meta.title: Cookie Policy
meta.description: Detailed information about the cookies and similar technologies used on domains operated by Consphera Teknoloji ve Danışmanlık Ltd. Şti.

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.content_html:
This Cookie Policy explains the cookies and similar technologies used on the following domains (the “Site”) operated by Consphera Teknoloji ve Danışmanlık Ltd. Şti. (“Company”, “we”):

  • easycustoms360.com, tr.easycustoms360.com and their subdomains

This notice is prepared to fulfil our information duties under the Turkish Data Protection Law (KVKK) and, where applicable, the EU GDPR.

1) What is a cookie? What are similar technologies?

A “cookie” is a small text file stored on your browser/device when you visit a website. Similar technologies include local storage (localStorage/sessionStorage), pixel tags, SDKs and cookie-like identifiers. These technologies are used for purposes such as maintaining sessions, security, remembering preferences and measuring Site performance.

2) Types of cookies

By duration

  • Session cookies: Deleted when the browser is closed.
  • Persistent cookies: Remain on the device for a defined period.

By source

  • First-party: Placed directly by the Site.
  • Third-party: Placed by our partners/service providers.

By purpose

  • Strictly necessary: Site operation, security, fraud prevention. (No consent required.)
  • Preferences/Functionality: Remembers language, currency, appearance, etc.
  • Performance/Analytics: Measures usage and engagement to drive improvements.
  • Advertising/Targeting: Delivers interest-based content and measurement.

3) What data is processed?

Through cookies and similar tech we may process: masked IP, device/browser info, session/cookie ID, referrer page, clickstream, viewed pages, form interactions, preferred language, timestamps and pseudonymous identifiers in advertising categories. Where possible, your data is processed in aggregated/anonymous or pseudonymized form.

4) Why we use cookies

  • Authentication, session management, load balancing and security
  • Account operations, payments and fraud prevention
  • Remembering preferences such as language/currency/tenant
  • Performance/analytics measurement and product/UX improvements
  • Effective display of campaigns, announcements and service promotions

5) Legal basis

Strictly necessary cookies: Legal obligation and/or legitimate interests (KVKK Art.5/2; GDPR Art.6(1)(c)-(f)).
Preferences, Analytics, Advertising cookies: Consent (KVKK Art.5/1; GDPR Art.6(1)(a)).

You can give, update or withdraw your consent at any time via the Cookie Management Panel.

Prior blocking: Cookies requiring consent are not triggered until consent is given.

6) Third-party providers and international transfers

We may use third-party services for analytics, security, payments, marketing/communications and hosting. Cookies set by these providers are subject to their own policies and retention schemes; data may be transferred abroad. Appropriate safeguards (e.g., adequacy decisions, Standard Contractual Clauses – SCCs, explicit consent) are applied for transfers.

  • Analytics/Performance: Google Analytics / Plausible / Vercel Analytics (IP anonymization can be enabled).
  • Security/Performance: Cloudflare, (if needed) reCAPTCHA.
  • Payments & Tax: PayTR and Paddle (transaction security, tax compliance, fraud prevention).
  • Marketing/Comms: Meta Pixel, LinkedIn Insight Tag, email services.
  • Infrastructure/Session: Authentication, hosting and CDN services (e.g., Supabase Auth).

7) How to manage cookies

  • Cookie Management Panel: Use the banner or the “Cookie Preferences” link in the footer to enable/disable categories.
  • Browser settings: Most browsers allow blocking/deleting cookies.
  • Device/ads preferences: You may reset mobile ad IDs and limit interest-based ads.

Note: Disabling strictly necessary cookies may affect core Site functions and cause service interruptions.

8) Retention

  • Session cookies: Until the browser is closed.
  • Persistent cookies: 1 day to 24 months proportionate to purpose (varies by provider).

Up-to-date granular durations are published in the Cookie Management Panel and in Annex A.

9) Consent logs, IP anonymization and multi-tenant note

  • Consent logs: Preferences are stored per category with timestamp and a technical identifier. You can withdraw consent at any time.
  • IP anonymization: Where possible, IP truncation/masking is applied in analytics.
  • Multi-tenant note: This policy applies to all domains listed above and their subdomains. Tenant/country differences are reflected in the Panel and Annex A.

10) Your rights (KVKK and GDPR)

Under KVKK and (where applicable) GDPR you have the following rights:

  • Access, rectification/update, erasure (right to be forgotten)
  • Restriction of processing, objection
  • Data portability (GDPR)
  • Withdraw consent
  • Request information on international transfers

Submit your requests via the channels in the Contact section. We respond within 30 days at the latest.

Supervisory authority: If dissatisfied with our response, you may complain to the Turkish DPA (KVKK) or, if you reside in the EU, to your national Data Protection Authority.

11) Children’s privacy

Our services target adult users; we do not aim at children. If we become aware that we process children’s data, we take necessary measures and delete the data as soon as possible.

12) Changes to this Policy

We may update this Policy due to changes in our services or the law. The latest version is always available on this page; the effective and last update dates are shown above. Where necessary, we provide additional notice.

13) Contact

Data Controller: Consphera Teknoloji ve Danışmanlık Ltd. Şti.
Address: Nisbetiye Mahallesi, Nisbetiye Caddesi No:24 Da:17 Beşiktaş /İSTANBUL
Email: support@easycustoms360.com

Annex A — Cookies used (example template; update according to your setup)

Cookie NameProviderCategoryPurposeDurationFirst/Third Party
__Host-next-auth.csrf-tokenSiteStrictly necessarySession security (CSRF protection)SessionFirst
sb-access-tokenSite (Supabase)Strictly necessaryAuthentication1 day (example)First
sb-refresh-tokenSite (Supabase)Strictly necessarySession refresh7 days (example)First

askAiNotice.title: AI Review Notice
askAiNotice.intro: This section explains how your question and attachments are processed. Please read and confirm before continuing.

bullets.1: Your question and attachments are analyzed by AI for pricing estimation.
bullets.2: Dozens of criteria are considered (technical difficulty, regulatory scope, number of documents, urgency, foreign language, need for calculations, etc.).
bullets.3: Accordingly, your content is read by AI and processed solely for price/workload estimation and quality pre-check.
bullets.4: The review is performed via the
bullets.5a: OpenAI does not use API-submitted data to train models
bullets.6a: OpenAI may retain API input/output logs for abuse monitoring for up to
bullets.6b: then deletes them (except where required by law). Source:
bullets.7a: At EasyCustoms360, we process your content
bullets.7b: only for pricing and quality pre-check
bullets.7c: and we do not use it for any other purpose nor allow such use.
bullets.8: If you include trade secrets, please remove unnecessary personal data (IDs, birth dates, IBAN, etc.); mask sensitive details in files.
bullets.9: You can find our detailed privacy notice and KVKK/GDPR principles on the “How It Works” page.

summary.title: Summary :
summary.text: “My content is processed by AI only for price/workload estimation and quality pre-check; it is not used for model training by EasyCustoms360 or OpenAI.”

askAiNotice.consentLabel: I have read and understood, and I consent to the processing of my content for these purposes.
askAiNotice.note: Note: You may see this dialog again if you clear your browser data.

notFound.title: Page not found
notFound.body: The page you’re looking for may have been moved, deleted, or never existed.

hero_i18n.description: Upload your question and documents; the system pre-checks and generates a clear quote with a target SLA.
bullets: Minimisation of risks and costs through accurate declaration and regulatory compliance
Full integration with ConspheraPSA for managing all processes through a single channel
Process transparency and traceability and team management in corporate membership
Fast delivery and clear SLAs: Customs Consultancy at the right time, at the right cost

cards.title: Fast Answers to Regulatory Questions
cards.desc: Accurate outcomes through expert consultant matching.

cards.title: Instant, Tailored Quote for Your Question
cards.desc: The Consphera PSA engine reviews your case and prices it against dozens of criteria, speeding up the process.

cards.title: Corporate Membership
cards.desc: Authorize your team and manage all questions and usage from a single dashboard.

cards.title: More Value with Credits
cards.desc: Buy credits in bulk and get the same quality with tiered discounts.

hero.title: Streamline your customs & trade operations

footer_i18n.aboutDesc: Fast, reliable and transparent digital experience in customs & trade advisory.

about.title: About

items.a: Customs advisory, pre-check, and regulation research.

cookies.title: Cookies Policy
cookies.intro: This page explains the types of cookies we use, their purposes, and how to manage your preferences.

what.p: Cookies are small text files placed on your browser when you visit a website.

third.p: Analytics and marketing providers may set cookies.

ret.p: Session cookies are deleted on browser close; persistent cookies may last 1–24 months.

manage.p: Use your browser settings or our cookie banner to manage consent by category.

contact.p: For questions, see our contact page.

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.intro: This Cookie Policy explains the types of cookies used by EasyCustoms360 and how you can manage your preferences.

what.title: 1. What Are Cookies?
what.body: Cookies are small text files placed in your browser by websites you visit. They are used for session management, security, personalization and analytics.

items.title: Strictly necessary
items.body: Required for login, session management and security.

items.title: Analytics
items.body: Collect anonymous usage to improve our services.

thirdParties.title: 3. Third Parties
thirdParties.body: Hosting, analytics and notification providers may use cookies or similar technologies.

manage.title: 4. Managing Cookies
manage.body: You can delete, block or limit cookies via your browser settings. Disabling cookies may affect certain features.

banner.title: Cookie Preferences
banner.body: We use cookies to improve your experience. You can accept, reject, or customize your preferences.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions

items.a: Short answer: with a GPT-based pricing model. Details coming soon.

howItWorks.title: How it works
howItWorks.intro: We’ll add more details soon. Here’s the basic flow:
steps: Step 2: Review and approve the offer.

kvkkGdpr.title: Privacy Notice (KVKK / GDPR)
kvkkGdpr.intro: This Privacy Notice is provided by EasyCustoms360 as the data controller under applicable law. When processing falls within the scope of the EU GDPR, we follow the principles below.

personalData.title: 1. Categories of Personal Data
items: Account data: profile, session and authorization logs.
Operations: support tickets, messages, attachments, timestamps.
Technical data: IP address, browser info, cookies.

purposes.title: 2. Purposes
items: Providing services and managing your account,
Compliance with legal obligations and auditing.

legalBases.title: 3. Legal Bases
legalBases.body: GDPR Art. 6(1)(b) performance of a contract, Art. 6(1)(c) legal obligation, Art. 6(1)(f) legitimate interests; and where required, Art. 6(1)(a) consent. Under Turkish law, corresponding KVKK bases may apply.

transfers.title: 4. Disclosures & International Transfers
transfers.body: We may share data with service providers (hosting/cloud, email, notifications, analytics) and with authorities when required. For transfers outside the EEA, appropriate safeguards (e.g., Standard Contractual Clauses under Art. 46 GDPR) apply.

retention.title: 5. Retention
retention.body: We retain data as long as necessary to provide the services and to meet legal obligations, then delete or anonymize it.

rights.title: 6. Your Rights
rights.body: Under GDPR Arts. 15–22 you have rights to access, rectify, erase, restrict, object, and data portability. Please contact us using the details below.

info.title: Information
info.li1: All advisory answers are prepared by competent/qualified experts.
info.li2: The information/answers provided are not definitive or binding. You must verify with the relevant public authorities before taking action.
info.li3: To the extent permitted by law, no liability is accepted for any loss (direct/indirect, special, incidental, or loss of profit/reputation/data) arising from the Platform or the Services.
info.li4: Prices include VAT and are charged at the time of payment (via the authorized payment provider).
info.li5: Given the digital nature of the service, fees or used credits are non-refundable. Only in case of an erroneous charge, a pro-rata refund or credit may be provided.
info.li6: You are responsible for account security and for the accuracy of any information/documents you share.
info.li7: The Platform is provided “as is/as available”; uninterrupted service is not guaranteed.

header.title: Ask a Question

precheck.notClear: Your question isn’t clear. Please add specific item/HS code, transaction type, and context.
precheck.outOfScope: Your question seems outside customs regulation scope.

worker.title: Consultant Selection
worker.label: Consultant
worker.helpText: You may select a consultant from the list. If you don’t, EasyCustoms360’s experienced team will handle your question.

descHelp.title: Important Note
descHelp.intro: Provide concrete details for accurate pricing. File attachments clarify scope and can positively affect pricing. Open-ended questions may be treated broadly and increase the price.

bullets.lang: Unless otherwise specified, your question will be answered in the language of the question. Specifying a different language or requesting answers in multiple languages may affect pricing.
bullets.time: If the “Urgent” option is selected, the delivery time is reduced and an urgent fee multiplier is applied.

api.title_too_short: Title must be at least 3 characters.

scope.heading: SCOPE
scope.intro: This offer defines the framework of the customs and foreign trade advisory service for the subject/question specified above. The work is carried out by a competent/qualified team and includes the following steps:
scope.step1_body: Your question and any attached documents/information submitted to the Portal are recorded.
scope.step1_note: Missing items are not chased; the assessment is performed strictly based on the information you provide.
scope.step2_body: A topic-specific review is conducted within the scope of the Customs Law, secondary legislation, communiqués/circulars, international rules and administrative practice.

delivery.heading: DELIVERY
delivery.present: Answer Delivery: The final advisory answer is published in the “Answer” section on the Portal and simultaneously sent to you by e-mail.
delivery.time: Timeline: The target delivery date is indicated above. (It is based on the information/document set you provided.)
delivery.revision: Revision: Within the initial scope and assumptions, one short revision right is available within 7 days after delivery. Sending new data/scenarios constitutes a scope change.

terms.heading: TERMS & CONDITIONS
terms.b1: All advisory answers are prepared by competent/qualified experts.
terms.b2: The information/answers provided are not definitive or binding. You must verify with the relevant public authorities before taking action.
terms.b3: To the extent permitted by law, no liability is accepted for any loss (direct/indirect, special, incidental, or loss of profit/reputation/data) arising from the Platform or the Services.
terms.b4: Prices include VAT and are charged at the time of payment (via the authorized payment provider).
terms.b5: Given the digital nature of the service, fees or used credits are non-refundable. Only in case of an erroneous charge, a pro-rata refund or credit may be provided.
terms.b6: You are responsible for account security and for the accuracy of any information/documents you share.
terms.b7: The Platform is provided “as is/as available”; uninterrupted service is not guaranteed. See the Terms of Service for details.

approval.heading: ACKNOWLEDGMENT
approval.body: I have read and understood the preliminary information under this offer; I acknowledge that the information is for informational purposes only, that I must verify with public authorities before making final decisions, that no liability is accepted, that prices include VAT and are charged instantly, and that there are no refunds for fees or used credits (except erroneous charges). I have read the Terms of Service.
